title: Frida Kahlo Inspired Photo Deconstruction
summary: Photographer Lindsay Adler breaks down a Frida Kahlo-inspired beauty shoot, detailing the research process, a complex 5-light setup using gels and optical modifiers, camera settings, and post-processing techniques to achieve a dramatic, painterly look.

steps.action: Research the artist's style (Frida Kahlo) to identify key elements: self-portraiture, nature/jungle themes, saturated colors, and specific physical traits like the unibrow.
Set up the Main Light using an optical spot to create a tight slice of light down the center of the subject's face.
Set up the Fill Light to the front right using a large umbrella with diffusion and a Magenta gel to add pink detail to the shadows.
Set up two Rim Lights behind the subject on either side using barn doors and full CTO (Color Temperature Orange) gels to create separation and match the orange dress.
Add atmosphere to the scene using haze spray. The backlighting from the rim lights catches the haze to create texture and depth.
Set up a Background Light using a bare strobe with a Magenta gel hidden behind the subject to create a color gradient on the background.
Configure camera settings for a sharp studio shot: 1/200 sec shutter speed, f/11 aperture, and ISO 400.
Use a diffusion filter on the lens to bloom highlights and soften skin for a more painterly look.
Process the RAW file by increasing contrast, popping the whites, and lightening/desaturating the skin tone in the center of the face.
Retouch the image to extend the hair (if cut off in frame) and remove distracting elements like moles that interfere with shadow lines.

key_takeaways: Use historical art for inspiration to give work longevity.
Assign a specific job to every light in a multi-light setup (Main, Fill, Rim, Background).
Use gels (Magenta and CTO) to create a cohesive analogous color palette.
Atmosphere (haze) combined with backlighting adds significant depth and texture.
In-camera filtration (Black Pro-Mist) can reduce the 'digital' look and add a painterly glow.
